intro: Microstylis brachyrrhynchos, commonly known as the narrow-styled microstylis, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as sedges. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soils and partial shade. Its flowers are generally inconspicuous, with tiny, three-lobed perianths that are adapted for wind pollination. Microstylis brachyrrhynchos is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and morphological features.
